M510208-d-01-29-08-PCC.Accident Cause: Hand brake (including gear) broken or defective
M510208-d-01-29-08-PCC.Narrative: CONDUCTOR STATES LEFT A SINGLE LOADED COAL CAR IN THE MIDDLE TRACK OF THE COAL YARD AT THE TXI COALYARD AND TIED THE HAND BRAKE PRIOR TO CUTTING AWAY FROM THE CAR. IT WAS THE ONLY CAR LEFT IN THE TRACK AND ABOUT 5 CARS SOUTH OF THE BUMPER. THE CONDUCTOR STATES HE DID NOT TEST THE BRAKE AS REQUIREDAND THE OTHER 2 CREW MEMBERS SAW HIM TIE DOWN THE CAR. THE CREW CUT AWAY FROM THE CAR AND PROCEEDEDDOWN THE HILL TO THE RECEIVING TRACKS TO WORK ON THEIR ENGINE AS IT QUIT LOADING. APPROXIMATELY 10 TO 15 MINUTES PAST AND THEY NOTICED THAT THE CAR WAS MOVING UNCONTROLLED DOWN THE HILL TOWARD THE ENGINE. BOTH CREW MEMBERS ON THE ENGINE BAILED WITHIN SECONDS OF THE IMPACT. THE COAL CAR COLLIDED WITHTHE ENGINE BAR 365 AND SHOVED IT APPOX 50 YARDS TO A STOP, EST IMPACT SPEED OF APPROX 20 MPH. NO DERAILMENT OCCURRED. MINIMAL DAMAGE TO LOADED COAL CAR. DAMAGE TO LOCO FORTHCOMING AFTER FURTHER INSPECTION. NO INJURIES REPORTED BY CREW MEMBERS. UP MECHANICAL MANAGER MIKE EPIDAKA ASSISTED IN THE CAUSE INVESTIGATION AND DETERMINED THAT THE RATCHET SYSTEM OF THE HAND BRAKE ASSEMBLY WAS DEFECTIVE IN SUCH A WAY THAT ONCE OPERATED, THE HAND BRAKE GAVE THE APPEARANCE OF BEING PROPERLY APPLIED, BUT WASNOT IN REALITY.

MEB002-d-01-08-08-NIRC.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 7:20A.M. ON JANUARY 8, 2008, CAR #1646 STARTED ON FIRE ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE CAR ONTRAIN #702 GOING NORTHBOUND ON TRACK #4.  IT STARTED ON UP MAIN AT 87TH ST MILE POST 10.86 AND TRAIN STOPPED AT 83RD ST. MILE POST 10.40. TRAIN #702 WAS A SIX CAR CONSIST CONSISTING OF LEAD LOCOMOTIVE #1604, 1639, 1550, 1649, 1646, AND 1533.  THIS WAS IN CTC TERRITORY WITH TRACK SPEED OF 65MPH.  CAR #1646 WAS THE FIFTH LOCOMOTIVE IN THE CONSIST.  APPROXIMATELY 170 PASSENGERS WERE EVACUATED FROM LOCOMOTIVE #1649 AND LOCOMOTIVE #1533 INTO THE FIRST FOUR LOCOMOTIVES.  THEY CUT LOCOMOTIVE #1646 ANDLOCOMOTIVE #1533 AND CONTINUED INTO CHICAGO WITH THE FIRST FOUR LOCOMOTIVES.  THE DAMAGE AND FIRE WERE ONLY ON LOCOMOTIVE #1646, THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO LOCOMOTIVE #1533.  THE FIRE OCCURED ON #1646 INTWO DIFFERENT AREAS ON THE OUTSIDE OF #1646, IT WAS THE HIGH SPEED CIRCUIT BREAKER BOX ON TOP OF THE ROOF BY THE PANOGRAPHS, AND BETWEEN THE GRID BANKS AT THE BOTTOM OF #1646.  METRA HAS DECIDED TO RETIRE LOCOMOTIVE #1646 DUE TO THE DAMAGES.

D640508-d-01-13-08-LAS.Narrative: WHILE DEPARTING GIBSLAND FOR HODGE, JOB 3 DERAILED 3 CHIP CARS.  THE CREW WAS LEAVING OUT OF TRACK 7ON THE KCS WHEN THE 26TH CAR IN THE TRAIN DERAILED ON THE LNW LOCOMOTIVE SHOP SWITCH.  IT TRAVELEDABOUT 100' BEFORE TURNING OVER.  IT THEN PULLED THE CAR HEAD AND BEHIND IT OVER.  THE CAR AHEAD STRUCK THE LNW SHOP BUILDING, DOING ABOUT $40,000 IN DAMAGE.  THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS DEFECTIVETIES AHEAD OF THE SWITCH AND AT THE HILL BLOCK CAUSING THE SWITCH POINTS TO RISE UP ALLOWING THE WHEEL TO PICK UP THE SWITCH.  THE INCIDENT WAS INVESTIGATED BY KCS AND LAS PERSONAL.  THE OUTSIDE RAILAT THE SWITCH HAD BEEN CHANGED OUT ON THE THURSDAY BEFORE THE DERAILMENT AND THE KCS SIGNAL DEPARTMENT HAD BOUND THE SWITCH BACK INTO THE INTERLOCKED.  THERE WERE NUMEROUS COMPONENTS IN THE SWITCH THAT WERE NOT UP TO FRA GUIDELINES.

205108-d-01-28-08-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 153 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF YARDING THEIR TRAIN ON TRACK 18 AND INSTRUCTED BY THE IOC TO SET OVER TO TRACK 19 AND FILL THE TRACK UP, THEN HE WOULD ADVISE THEM ON WHAT TO DO WITH THE REMAINDER OF THE TRAIN. THE CREW ON TRAIN 153-26 MADE A CUT ON THEIR TRAIN AND PULLED AHEAD OVER THE TRACK 18 SWITCH, CONDUCTOR GAVE THE ENGINEER A CAR COUNT OF 40 CARS AND TOLD HIM THE TRACK WAS CLEAR. THE CONDUCTOR THEN GOT IN A TAXI CAB AND BEGAN TO RIDE ALONG SIDE THE CARS GOING INTO TRACK 19, HE THEN GAVE THE ENGINEER A CAR COUNT OF 30 CARS, THEN 20 CARS, AND THEN 15 CARS. AFTER HE SAID 15 CARS HE THEN TOLD HIM 8 CARS, A COUPLE OF SECONDS LATER HE TOLD TRAIN 153 'LETS MAKE IT AN EASY STOP, THAT WILL DO'.THE ENGINEER ASKED THE CONDUCTOR, "DID YOU SAY, THAT WILL DO", THE CONDUCTOR RESPONDED "YES, THAT WILL DO". TRACK 19 COLLIDED WITH TRACK 18 WHICH WAS OUT ON THE LEAD AT THE SOUTH END OF SCHILLER PARK. THE COLLISION CAUSED 4 CARS TO DERAIL AND KNOCKED OVER A TELEPHONE POLE AND POWER LINE. AS THE CREW WAS WORKING ON CHANNEL 65-65 THE CONDUCTOR STATED THAT THE BENSENVILLE STRIP JOB WAS ALSO WORKINGON THE SAME CHANNEL AND THAT HIS TRANSMITIONS OVER THE RADIO HAD BEING WALKED ON AS HE TRIED TO TALKWITH HIS ENGINEER.

200801-d-01-23-08-EWG.Narrative:
PLEASE SEE ATTACHED REPORTS.  NO DRUG/ALCOHOL INVOLVEMENT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS DERAILMENT.  PRIMARYCAUSE WAS SNOW AND ICE CLOGGING SIDE TRACK, COUPLED WITH CONDUCTOR NOR ADEQUATELY OBSERVING SIDE TRACK CONDITIONS. AT 1620 HRS, 01-23-08, I WAS TRAVELING WESTBOUND WITH THREE LOCOMOTIVES (NIWX 8924, NIWX 375, MRL 260) AT MPH THROUGH CRESTON, WASHINGTON, PREPARING TO STOP AT THE WEST ROAD CROSSING TOCUT OFF 26 OF THE 41 EMPTY GRAIN HOPPERS I WAS PULLING, TO SPOT THE CWGG FACILITY AT CRESTON. AFTERMAKING  THE SEPARATION ON THE TRAIN AT THE WEST ROAD CROSSING IN CRESTON,, I PULLED FORWARD ABOUT 15 CAR LENGTHS TO CLEAR THE WEST SWITCH, 
WHICH CONDUCTOR COUNTED ME DOWN AND STOOPED ME WHEN I CLEARED THE SWITCH.  AFTER LINING THE SWITCH AND CONFIRMING THE PROPER ROUTE ( NO DERAILS AT CRESTON) IBEGAN BACKING THE 26 EMPTY GRAIN HOPPERS INTO THE SIDING, SHOVING TOWARD THE CWGG FACILITY FOR SPOTTING.  ABOUT 15 CARS INTO THE SIDING AND OVER THE WEST ROAD CROSSING WITH THE REAR CAR, CONDUCTOR TOLD ME TO STOP, STOP, QUICK, AT WHICH TIME I PUT THE BRAKES INTO EMERGENCY, COMING TO A STOP IN ABOUT3 CAR LENGTHS.  AFTER STOPPING, I ASKED CONDUCTOR WHAT WAS WRONG, AND HE RESPONDED HE THOUGH HE HADSIDE-SWIPED THE CARS.  I TOLD HIM THAT WAS IMPOSSIBLE AS WE HAD CUT THE TRAIN OFF SOME 15 CAR LENGTHS FROM THE WEST SWITCH.  HE THEN RELAYED THAT THE REAR CAR WAS ON THE GROUND ON THE EAST END ONLY.I ASKED HIM IF  WE COULD POSSIBLY PULL SLOWLY BACK WEST TO RERAIL THE CAR.  HE SAID HE THOUGH IT

A COLLISION OCCURRED BETWEEN THE 15TH AND16TH CARS OF R97091-18 CAUSING DAMAGE TO 10 CARS, DERAILING 5 OF THEM.  THE DAMAGED CARS WHERE: XOMX710488, SHPX205824, ACFX418896, UTCX49606, CRGX29053, CRGX8132, BNSF561473, CNWX520060, PLMX135539AND PTNX1011.  OF THESE CARS THE FOLLOWING WERE DERAILED: CRGX29053, UTCX49606, ACFX41896, SHPX205824, AND CN45317.  ALL CARS EXCEPT XOMX710488 AND  WERE DERAILED: CRGX29053, UTCX49606, ACFX41896, SHPX205824, AND CN45317.  ALL CARS EXCEPT XOMX410488 AND BNSF561473 WERE EMPTY.  CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO CAR CN45317 NOT BEING PROPERLY SECURED IN TRACK 17.

OP010708ID-d-01-07-08-INPR.Contributing Accident Cause: Other mechanical and electrical failures, (LOCOMOTIVE) (Provide detailed description in narrative)
OP010708ID-d-01-07-08-INPR.Narrative:
ENGINEER STARTED LOCOMOTIVE 4503 AND PUT THE INPR4505 IN TRAILING MODE, THEN WENT TO 4503 TO PUT INLEAD MODE.  ENGINEER THEN STARTED GROUND INSPECTION WHEN THE LOCOMOTIVE STARTED REVVING UP HIGH ANDBLACK SMOKE APPEARED.  THE ENGINEER THEN TRIED TO SHUT DOWN THE LOCMOTIVE.  THE CONDUCTOR AND ENGINEER TRIED PUTTING OUT THE FIRE IN THE MAIN GENERATOR AREA WITH 2 FIRE EXTINGUISHERS AND WERE UNSUCCESSFUL.  THEY CALLED 911 AND THE NAMPA FIRE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED AND EXTINGUISHED THE FLAMES.
